decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 combo deck is to utilize Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion and combo off with cards like Apex Devastator, Maelstrom Wanderer, and Emergent Ultimatum to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes various lands to ramp up quickly, as well as disruptive cards like Tibalt's Trickery and Violent Outburst to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to generate powerful combinations and overwhelm the opponent with its versatility and unpredictability.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells, while also having card advantage and flexibility with cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board state with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Prismatic Ending. Card advantage and selection is achieved through Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck is designed to maintain control of the game until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game with powerful threats like Flame of Anor and Vivi Ornitier.

The main concept of this deck is to use artifacts and blue cards to generate fast mana and card advantage in order to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. It utilizes cards like Mox Opal, Lotus Petal, and Mishra's Bauble to accelerate its plays, while also including powerful creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Memory Guardian to apply pressure. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent with cards like Pithing Needle and Force of Will, while also generating value with cards like Thoughtcast and Urza's Bauble.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a fast and aggressive tempo. It uses a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, efficient removal like Fatal Push, and powerful creatures like Murktide Regent to control the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's tempo strategy, with lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and pressure the opponent to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudposts and Urza's Tower to cast powerful spells and creatures such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect your key pieces. The goal is to efficiently control the board and overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats while utilizing the combo potential of cards like Tishana's Tidebinder and Planar Nexus for maximum impact.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library and win with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck includes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card draw and interaction, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Prismatic Ending. It has a toolbox land package with Urza's Saga and utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Hedge Maze. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a win in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures by utilizing mana acceleration and disruption. By using cards like Cavern of Souls and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can play threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void helps to disrupt opponents' strategies, while Wasteland and Wastescape Battlemage provide additional ways to control the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with a mix of mana denial and disruptive spells.

This Combo - Show and Tell Legacy deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier by utilizing the Show and Tell card along with Omniscience to cheat them into play. The deck also features ways to protect itself with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The goal is to set up the combo as quickly as possible and overwhelm the opponent with massive threats that can win the game in just a few turns.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures into play from the graveyard quickly using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also controlling the board with cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes cards like Ponder and Brainstorm for card selection and manipulation, as well as Wasteland for land disruption. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bring them back into play with Reanimate. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The inclusion of creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent provide powerful threats that can quickly end the game once reanimated. Additionally, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide card advantage and utility while Orcish Bowmasters offer removal for problematic creatures. The deck also includes some land destruction with Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt your opponent's hand and board state while efficiently dealing damage with creatures and powerful spells. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Cabal Therapy, and Swords to Plowshares to control the game, while creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls provide a fast clock. This deck also has a strong synergy with sacrificing creatures for value with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency and access to all colors.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck runs a suite of efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending deal with threats on the board. The planeswalkers, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and powerful finishers like Murktide Regent provide card advantage and win conditions. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and take over the game with its powerful spells and threats.

The deck focuses on generating a massive amount of mana through Cloudpost and Urza's Tower to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Emrakul. It uses cards like Karn, the Great Creator and The One Ring to search for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Crop Rotation and Boseiju, Who Endures help to protect the combo while Elvish Spirit Guide provides additional acceleration. The deck also includes ways to deal with graveyard strategies with Bojuka Bog and Soul-Guide Lantern. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, high-powered threats and lock down the game with powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the "Show and Tell" card as a means to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play. By combining this with cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful board states and overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opposing strategies, while utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to ramp into its powerful plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo using cards like Thoughtseize, Dark Ritual, and Personal Tutor to set up a winning sequence with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, as well as cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm for card selection. The deck aims to win the game by casting Doomsday, sequencing your library in the most efficient way possible, and then winning with Thassa's Oracle.

The deck focuses on using various spells like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to quickly and efficiently bring powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces, while also utilizing card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary combo cards. The deck is designed to assemble its combo pieces as quickly as possible and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats, aiming to win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.
